title: Identify $$\frac{Input}{Output}$$
text: Think about the variables that are usually assigned to input and output. We are given years, which is time, and this is the input. So, population must be the output.

title: Defining y-intercept
text: We will define our input, time, as years after $$2004$$. So, given a 6,200 population in $$2004$$, we have the point (0, 2,400), our y-intercept.

title: Finding Slope
text: Find slope by solving (output2 - output1)/(input2-input1), which gets us (8,100-6,200)/(5-0)=380 $$\frac{population}{year}$$

title: Writing a Linear Model
text: Because we have the y-intercept and the slope, we can write an equation: y=380*x+6,200

title: Applying a Linear Model
text: To predict the population in $$2013$$, we recognize that $$2013$$ $$=$$ $$9$$ years after $$2004$$ and $$x=9$$. Plug in to find y=380*9+6,200=9,620
